sub_title: Helping schools improve teaching and learning through instructional coaching
summary:
I am an experienced educator and entrepreneur, working to improve the quality of teaching and learning internationally. 

My experience includes:
* Teacher development -- designed and managed innovative programmes, focused on critical thinking and problem solving, improving the quality of learning in a low-income context, etc.
* Curriculum development -- collaborated with teams of teachers and domain experts to design new curriculum units on science, critical thinking, problem solving, etc.
* Teacher recruitment -- recruited highly capable university graduates with strong academic and socio-emotional skills to join the teaching profession and teach in low-resource contexts.
* Research -- developed a deep understanding of the research on the science of learning, the development needs of children, effective learning environments, etc.
* Education policy -- collaborated with policy makers around the world; advised a high performing school system on how to improve the quality of teaching and learning further.

The purpose is to share some of the most salient lessons about teaching, school leadership, community and policy leadership from across our global network:
http://teachforall.org/network-learning', 'title': 'Vice President, Leadership and Learning (Interim)', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'London, United Kingdom', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'Teach For All', 'description': 'Responsible for supporting the professional development of teachers and school leaders in 25+ countries through conferences, workshops, fellowships and online learning opportunities.

Lessons learned:
* Sense of possibility - witnessing exceptional student learning in challenging schools can have a very powerful motivational effect on teachers. This experience can inspire them and their students to go far beyond their own expectations.
* Knowledge and skills - motivation to change cannot be sustained unless one sees real positive improvements in terms of the student learning in their own classrooms and schools. This requires sustained effort from teachers and school leaders to improve their knowledge and skills.
* Conditions of learning - creating the right conditions for learning is paramount. Adults need to be in charge of their own learning, relevance is key, learning from peers and role models need to complement each other, learning needs to be sustained, stories are a powerful tool to communicate new ideas.', 'title': 'Vice President, Synergies', 'employment_type': None}]}]
